titleStmt.title: Corpus parlamentar português ParlaMint-PT-en, Série I, Legislatura XIV [ParlaMint-en.ana SAMPLE]
Portuguese parliamentary corpus ParlaMint-PT-en, Series I, Term XIV [ParlaMint-en.ana SAMPLE]
Minutas da Assembleia da República Portuguesa, Sessão 2, Número 26
Minutes of the Assembly of the Portuguese Republic, Session 2, Number 26

respStmt.resp: Machine translation to English and linguistic analysis of the translation
Annotating MTed corpora with USAS semantic tags

funder.orgName: Centre of Linguistics of the University of Lisbon

availability.p: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License

bibl.title: Minutes of the Assembleia da República of Portugal

projectDesc.p: ParlaMint is a project that aims to (1) create a multilingual set of comparable corpora of parliamentary proceedings uniformly encoded according to the ParlaMint encoding guidelines, covering the period from 2015 to mid-2022; (2) add linguistic annotations to the corpora and machine-translate them to English; (3) make the corpora available through concordancers; and (4) build use cases in Political Sciences and Digital Humanities based on the corpus data.

prefixDef.p: Private URIs with this prefix point to aligned source elements of the MTed corpus.

div.head: Sexta-feira, 4 de dezembro de 2020 I Série — Número 26
XIV LEGISLATURA 2.ª SESSÃO LEGISLATIVA (2020-2021)
div.note: Chairman: H.E. Mr. Eduardo Luís Barreto Ferro Rodrigues
Secretaries: Ex.mos Sr. Duarte Rogério Matos Ventura Pacheco Nelson Ricardo Esteves Peralta

SUMMARY The President declared the meeting open at 3 p.m. The entry into the Bureau of Bills Nos 582 to 587/XIV/2.a and 589/XIV/2.a and Resolution Projects Nos 767 to 773/XIV/2.a was given. In a political statement, Mr João Oliveira (PCP) stressed the importance of holding the XXI PCP Congress in the current context of the COVID-19 pandemic, respecting all health safety rules, to give hope and confidence to workers. He then responded to requests for clarification by Carlos Peixoto (PSD), José Luís Ferreira (PEV), Pedro Filipe Soares (BE) and João Paulo Correia (PS). In the end, the President welcomed Mr Jerónimo de Sousa (PCP) for his re-election as Secretary-General of the CFP. In a political statement, Mrs Ana Rita Bessa (CDS-PP) drew attention to the Vaccination Plan for COVID-19, highlighting a set of 10 questions to which the Government must answer in order to be a successful process. He then responded to requests for clarification by the representatives Alberto Machado (PSD), João Cotrim de Figueiredo (IL), João Dias (PCP), Maria Antónia de Almeida Santos (PS), Mois Ferreira (BE) and André Ventura (CH). In a political statement, Mrs Inês de Sousa Real (PAN) referred to the crisis resulting from the COVID-19 pandemic and to the need for a robust response in social and economic terms, in particular to the problems that are living in the business fabric, and responded to requests for clarification by Mr Helga Correia (PSD), Mr Diana Ferreira (PCP), Mr João Piinho de Almeida (CDS-PP), Mr José Moura Soeiro (BE) and Mr Hugo Oliveira (PS). In a political statement, Mr José Luís Ferreira (PEV), in view of the end of the CTT contract for postal service, drew attention to the need to return to the Portuguese a quality public service, which he considered to have degraded since that company was privatized, and responded to requests for clarification by Mr Jorge Salgueiro Mendes (PSD), Mr Isabel Pires (BE), Mr Bruno Dias (PCP) and Mr Hugo Costa (PS). In a political statement, Mr Porfirio Silva (PS) stressed several initiatives adopted in the framework of the State budget with a view to protecting people and families in health or affected by the breakdown of economic activity, employment and income. He then responded to requests for clarification from Northern Christians (PSD), André Ventura (CH), Antonio Filipe (PCP), João Gonçalves Pereira (CDS-PP) and Moisés Ferreira (BE). In a political statement, Mr Alexandre Poço (PSD) warned of the difficulties faced by young people in the face of the current pandemic, economic and social crisis, such as unemployment or job insecurity, and called for new European funds to be used to build a Portugal of opportunities not only for new generations but also for older generations. He then responded to requests for clarification from Inês de Sousa Real (PAN), João Pinho de Almeida (CDS-PP), Luís Monteiro (BE), Maria Begonha (PS) and Alma Rivera (PCP). In a political statement, Mrs. Isabel Pires (BE) criticized the Government for the current situation of the TAP and reported on the submission of a request that the Minister of Infrastructures urgently present the restructuring plan of the company in the Assembly of the Republic, after which he responded to requests for clarification by Mr. João Cotrim de Figueiredo (IL), Mr. Carlos Silva (PSD), Mr. Bruno Dias (PCP) and Mr. Carlos Pereira (PS). In a political statement, Mr. João Cotrim de Figueiredo (IL) rose against a collective view of society, which says it has been demonstrated in the debate of the State budget, and defended that it is up to each person to decide and choose the direction he wants to give his life. In the end, he responded to requests for clarification by Mr Cecilia Meireles (CDS-PP) and Mr Fernando Anastácio (PS). Application No 5/XIV/1.a (FENPROF - National Federation of Teachers) — In defence of their professional dignity, teachers require respect for their rights, justice in careers, better working conditions, together with Resolution Projects No 653/XIV/2.a (BE) — By valuing the teaching career, 660/XIV/2.a (PCP) — Valuation of teachers and educators and improvement of their working conditions and 716/XIV/2.a (PEV) — Allocation of rights due to teachers. Members Joana Mortágua (BE), Ana Mesquita (PCP), Mariana Silva (PEV), Ana Rita Bessa (CDS-PP), Bebiana Cunha (PAN), Carla Sousa (PS) and Carla Madureira (PSD) spoke. Petition No 81/XIV/1.a (Portuguese Antifascist Resistant Union) — Rejection and demand that the announced creation of the Salazar Museum be stopped and abandoned, with that or other name, in Santa Comba Dan. Statements were made by Deputies António Filipe (PCP), Alexandra Vieira (BE), Rosário Gambôa (PS), Ana Rita Bessa (CDS-PP), Paulo Rios de Oliveira (PSD) and José Luís Ferreira (PEV). The entry into the Bureau of the Draft Law No 588/XIV/1.a was announced. The Members who were present, by video conference, at the plenary meeting were taken into account. The President (José Manuel Pureza) closed the session for 19 hours and 17 minutes.
Members' presences and shortcomings at the plenary meeting.
